Key Match Events: South Africa beat Sri Lanka by six wickets with 22 balls to spare
Sri Lanka dismissed for 77 after electing to bat - their lowest T20 total
Anrich Nortje takes four wickets; Rabada & Maharaj claim two
Maharaj dismisses Hasaranga & Samarawickrama with consecutive balls
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram: 'Happy with the win. Credit for what we did in the field but the batting was a bit up and down.'
Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga: 'We did want to bat first, we were hoping for 160-170 but now we know it was more of a 120-130 wicket, especially with our bowlers.'
Anrich Nortje: 'Just to get some momentum going, we've worked really hard and it's great to get a result.'
Prakash Wakankar: 'Now the pressure is on Sri Lanka because this is a tight group. They will want to make sure there are no more stumbles so they can get through to the Super 8s.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or field conditions affecting the match: The conditions were very bowler-friendly and the pitch was a bit of a heap in the end.
Historical comparisons or records beyond match performance: South Africa's explosive batting lineup couldn't get anything out of the pitch but had the benefit of knowing that it was tricky.
